aphids: Use insecticidal soap or neem oil to control aphids.
Introduce ladybugs or lacewings, natural predators of aphids, into the garden.
Prune affected plant parts to remove aphid colonies.
armyworm: Apply Bacillus thuringiensis (Bt) to control armyworm larvae.
Handpick and destroy armyworms when observed in small numbers.
Practice crop rotation to reduce armyworm populations.
bettel: Apply diatomaceous earth (DE) around affected plants to control beetles.
Use row covers to prevent adult beetles from laying eggs on plants.
Introduce parasitic nematodes to the soil to control beetle larvae.
boolworm: Apply insecticidal spray to control bollworm infestations.
Plant trap crops such as mustard or sunflower to lure bollworms away from main crops.
Handpick and destroy bollworm eggs and larvae when detected.
fruit_flies: Set up traps with apple cider vinegar or sugar water to catch fruit flies.
Keep kitchen surfaces clean and dispose of overripe fruits to prevent fruit fly infestations.
Cover fruit bowls or containers with mesh to prevent fruit fly access.
grasshopper: Apply insecticidal soap or neem oil to control grasshoppers.
Use barriers such as row covers or mesh to protect vulnerable plants from grasshopper feeding.
Introduce natural predators like birds or praying mantises to control grasshopper populations.
hornworms: Handpick and destroy hornworms when found on tomato plants.
Apply Bacillus thuringiensis (Bt) to control hornworm larvae.
Remove weeds that serve as alternative hosts for hornworms.
mites: Spray affected plants with a strong stream of water to dislodge mites.
Introduce predatory mites or ladybugs to control mite populations naturally.
Apply horticultural oils or insecticidal soap to suffocate and kill mites.
mosquito: Eliminate standing water sources to prevent mosquito breeding.
Use mosquito repellents containing DEET or picaridin when outdoors.
Install screens on windows and doors to prevent mosquitoes from entering indoor spaces.
sawfly: Apply insecticidal spray to control sawfly larvae.
Prune affected plant parts to remove sawfly-infested leaves or branches.
Introduce natural enemies such as parasitic wasps to control sawfly populations.
stem_borer: Remove and destroy infested plant stems to prevent stem borer spread.
Apply beneficial nematodes to the soil to control stem borer larvae.
Practice crop rotation to disrupt stem borer life cycles.
